 Relevant data

Basic Requirements:

  • SAML and OIDC federation is present

  • APIs for managing the solution are present

  • OIDC for authentication towards own services / for SSO capabilities

  • Hosting in Europe is possible

  • Customization of user facing UI is possible

  • Customization of user facing Emails is possible

  • A concept used for tenant management could be used

Requirements for self-hosted solutions:

  • Hosting in kubernetes is possible

  • Horizontal scaling is possible

  • All components could be built within kubernets or with AWS services

Other Factors:

  • flexible pricing and no fixed contingent pricing is available (e.g. pay-as-you-go pricing)

  • flexible API limits for masses of users are possible (e.g. scaling the API limits with the number of users)

  • avoid additional vendor in contracts with customers

Hint: There has already been a past vendor analysis for identity providers. See Vendor Analysis and Matrix

 Background

Currently there are different products or modules using different kinds of authentication mechanisms. For a joint solution one identity provider should be used to authenticte users in every product. This also enables API requests from one product to another using the same mechanism.

In addition this also enables a common SSO login for a new product development.

Intermediate outcome

A managed solution or a self-hosted solution will be used.

A self-built solutions will not be part of the final SSO solution.

The effort and risk to create self-made solution is too high and not effordable with the current set of people. There is no significant business value added by building a SSO component on our own as such a generic use-case is not part of the core domains we are working with.

 Outcome

pendingYellow Keycloak will be used an identity provider. There is good enough documentation to host it ourselves and it covers the main use-cases of CXI and DXI products.

Alternative Candidates are:

  • Gluu - as of now it seems to have a good offering

  • Cognito - as it integrates with other AWS services we are using
